p: As a non-systemic organophosphorus insecticide, temephos has extensively been used to treat water infested with disease-carrying insects, including mosquitoes, midges, and black fly larvae. It has also been recommended for the treatment of drinking-water sources and containers [ 112, 113]. Regrettably, resistance (and tolerance in this study) to temephos has been detected in the Culex spp. [ 114, 115], Aedes spp. [ 116â€“ 118], and An. stephensi [ 119, 120]. This issue sounds the alarm for using temephos in Iran and around the world.
